title: The Array Magic
subtitle: Manipulating Your Inventory
description:
# Mastering Array and List Operations

Your inventory is growing! Arrays have fixed sizes, so C# provides **List<T>** for dynamic collections. Let's learn how to add, remove, and modify items!

## Lists in C#

Lists are like arrays but can grow and shrink:

```csharp
using System.Collections.Generic;

List<string> items = new List<string> { "sword", "shield" };
items.Add("potion");  // Adds potion to the end
Console.WriteLine(string.Join(", ", items));  // sword, shield, potion
```

## Adding Items to Lists

### Add() - Add to the end
```csharp
List<string> items = new List<string> { "sword", "shield" };
items.Add("potion");
```

### Insert() - Add at a specific position
```csharp
List<string> items = new List<string> { "sword", "shield" };
items.Insert(1, "helmet");  // Inserts helmet at index 1
```

## Removing Items from Lists

### Remove() - Remove by value
```csharp
List<string> items = new List<string> { "sword", "shield", "potion" };
items.Remove("shield");  // Removes the shield
```

## Finding List Length

```csharp
List<string> items = new List<string> { "sword", "shield", "potion" };
int count = items.Count;  // Returns 3
Console.WriteLine($"You have {count} items");
```

## Your Quest

1. Create a List called `backpack` with: `"map"`, `"compass"`
2. Use `Add()` to add `"rope"` to the backpack
3. Use `Insert()` to add `"lantern"` at the **beginning** (index 0)
4. Print the number of items using `Count`
5. Remove `"compass"` from the backpack
6. Print the final backpack
hints: Use backpack.Add(item) to add an item to the end of a list
Use backpack.Insert(0, item) to add an item at the beginning
The Count property returns the number of items in a list
Use backpack.Remove(item) to remove a specific item by its value
After all operations, the backpack should have: lantern, map, rope
